brief_rationale: Foundational physics laws universally taught; any educated person can identify them.
One of the most fundamental physical principles, widely known from general education.
Broadly familiar concept from radio waves to gamma rays, widely taught in schools.
Universal physical constant known to virtually everyone; iconic physics concept.
Everyday physical phenomenon universally understood at a basic level.
Famous buoyancy principle known from popular culture and basic science education.
Common optical phenomenon observable in everyday life (bending light in water, prisms).
Widely referenced thermodynamic concept that has entered popular culture and general vocabulary.
Basic electrical concept understood by anyone who has dealt with circuits or household electricity.
Fundamental force observable in everyday magnets; universally familiar from childhood.
Well-known nuclear phenomenon widely covered in general education and popular media.
Einstein's famous theory; time dilation and E=mc² are cultural touchstones.
Everyday wave phenomenon; basic properties (speed, frequency, medium) are universally taught.
Rotational mechanics term requiring knowledge of angular motion vocabulary beyond basic Newtonian mechanics.
Wave phenomenon requiring knowledge of frequency shifts; familiar from ambulance sirens but technical details less known.
Foundational electromagnetism equations requiring specific physics vocabulary beyond general knowledge.
Specific electrical law requiring knowledge of voltage-current-resistance relationships.
Specific circuit component requiring knowledge of charge storage and electric fields.
Specific optics law relating angles of incidence and refraction; requires physics vocabulary.
Specific thermodynamic cycle requiring knowledge of heat engine theory and efficiency limits.
Specific electromagnetic induction law requiring knowledge beyond basic magnetism.
Force on charged particles in electromagnetic fields; requires specific EM vocabulary.
Specific nuclear process requiring knowledge of how heavy nuclei split; distinct from general radioactivity.
Particle physics framework requiring knowledge of fundamental particles and forces classification.
Famous particle requiring knowledge of mass generation mechanism and the Higgs field.
Einstein's gravity theory requiring understanding of spacetime curvature beyond special relativity.
Advanced reformulation of classical mechanics using energy methods; requires working knowledge of analytical mechanics.
Deep connection between symmetries and conservation laws; requires working understanding of theoretical physics.
Statistical mechanics distribution for particle speeds; requires working knowledge of thermal physics.
Fundamental fluid dynamics equations; requires working knowledge of continuum mechanics.
Dimensionless number for fluid flow regimes; requires working knowledge of fluid mechanics.
Optical phenomenon requiring understanding of critical angles and refractive index relationships.
Radiation from superluminal particles in media; requires working knowledge of relativistic particle physics.
Braking radiation from decelerated charges; requires working knowledge of electromagnetic radiation mechanisms.
Fictitious force in rotating frames; requires working knowledge of non-inertial reference frames.
Light scattering by small particles explaining sky color; requires working knowledge of wave-particle interactions.
Direction rule for induced currents; requires working knowledge of electromagnetic induction beyond Faraday's law.
Ratio of object speed to sound speed; requires working knowledge of compressible fluid dynamics.
Advanced phase-space reformulation of mechanics; requires deep knowledge of analytical mechanics and symplectic geometry.
Phase space volume conservation; requires deep knowledge of Hamiltonian dynamics and statistical mechanics foundations.
Electromagnetic energy flux; requires deep knowledge of advanced electrodynamics and energy transport.
Violation of charge-parity symmetry in particle physics; requires deep knowledge of discrete symmetries and the CKM matrix.
Exotic quantum state of matter at ultra-low temperatures; requires deep knowledge of quantum statistical mechanics.
Graphical tool for particle interaction calculations; requires deep knowledge of perturbative quantum field theory.
Energy distribution across degrees of freedom; requires deep knowledge of classical statistical mechanics and its limitations.
Stochastic differential equation for Brownian motion; requires deep knowledge of statistical physics and noise.
Precession of magnetic moments in external fields; requires deep knowledge of classical electrodynamics and spin dynamics.
Thermodynamic cost of information erasure; requires deep knowledge bridging information theory and statistical mechanics.
Framework of local symmetry invariance underlying modern physics; requires deep knowledge of theoretical physics foundations.
Symmetry of transport coefficients in non-equilibrium thermodynamics; requires deep knowledge of irreversible processes.
